result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Hansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Hansen

defendant.name: Hansen, Matthew J
defendant.address: 38 S Jonn Paul Rd, Milton, WI 53563

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
Probation review hearing on November 5, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF407, 16CM73, 16CM75, and 16CM85 called together at 11:24am [mo]
Defendant Matthew J Hansen in court with Attorney David Michael Stegall.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance; submits victim impact statements and restitution request forms as to cases 15CF407 & 16CM75

As to the State's Requested Amendment to Count #1 of Case 15CF407:
--arguments given by DA Happ
--The Court finds it is reasonable to amend as suggested; grants request

DA Susan Happ submits Amended Information as to Case 15CF407
--service admitted; reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 

As to Case 16CM75, Counts #1, #3, and #5: pleas of " GUILTY " entered.
As to Case 15CF407, Amended Count #1: plea of " GUILTY " entered.
As to Case 16CM73, Counts #1 and #2: pleas of " GUILTY " entered.

factual basis stipulated;  the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining counts/cases .


Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
The Court finds that each person identified is statutorily a victim and the amounts requested is allowable
The Court finds that Mr. Hansen has the ability to pay the amounts of restitution requested
The Court Court finds that Mr. Hansen is able bodied and has no impediment to gain full time employment

ADA Theresa Beck substitutes DA Happ
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Stegall

As to Case 16CM75, Counts #1, #3, and #5, Case 15CF407, Amended Count #1, and Case 16CM73, Counts #1 and #2:
The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 30 months, with conditions:

--As to Case 15CF407: to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH
--to pay statutory costs

The Court orders all restitution sought as outlined in the Criminal Case Settlement.
[which is/are:

--to pay drug surcharge in the amount of $50 (Case 16CM73)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $7643.24 to Mexico Enterprises Corp--joint but several (Case 15CF407)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $943.70 to Tuttle Pharmacy (Jon Tuttle)-- joint but several (16CM75)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $710.01 to Chris Scholl-- joint but several (16CM75)
--to pay restitution in the amount of 108.58 to Caleb T. Omorrow-- joint but several (16CM75)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $30 to Robert Meyer-- joint but several (16CM75)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $350 to Craig Lee-- joint but several (16CM75)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $250 to Michael Lee-- joint but several (16CM75)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $100 to Thomas Jung-- joint but several (16CM75)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $710 to Chris Scholl-- joint but several (16CM75)
--to pay restitution in the amount of $527.50 to Eric Mueller-- joint but several (16CM75)]


The Court orders all other conditions as recommended in the Criminal Case Settlement.
which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per agent
--absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances unless prescribed, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--no contact with Steven Shaurette]


The Court orders Mr. Hansen to provide a DNA sample

The Court grants expungement upon successful completion of Probation for cases 15CF407 and 16CM73, only

Days credit for time already served:  3  days
, to applied to all the cases
recess:12:11am
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Cases 15CF407, 16CM73, 16CM75, and 16CM85 called together at 3:36pm[mo]
Defendant Matthew J Hansen in court with Attorney David Michael Stegall.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Stegall infroms the Court that it was intended that all cases proceed to plea and sentencng today; further that assigned prosecutor needs additional time to prepare final settlement agreement.
Atty. Stegall has no objection to an adjournment

The Court grants the adjournment so long as plea and sentencing occurs prior to the scheduled Jury Trila on 15CF407.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 3:45pm

NEXT: AS TO ALL CASES: Plea/Sentencing on 5/23/16 at 11:15am
Court's review of 5-11-2016 filing from Attorney Stegall - Noted
from Attorney David Stegall enclosing documents for the Court to review prior to the 5-16-16 Plea/Sentencing
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of Intent to Admit Statements made by the Defendant
Notice of Prior Conviction of a Witness
Jury trial on May 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on April 4, 2016 at 08:10 am.
Motion hearing on April 1, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Cases 15CF407 and 15CF409 called together at 8:38am [mo]

Co- Defendant Matthew J Hansen in court with Attorney David Michael Stegall.   
Co- Defendant Steven L. Shaurette in court with Attorney Annamarie Wineke
ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occurs in both cases:

Mr. Shaurette   waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Mr. Hansen   waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.


Arraignment:
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts as to both Defendants
--Speedy trial requested by Mr. Shaurette

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
--2 day trial

The Court distributes it Scheduling Order
recess on Cases 15CF407 and 15CF409: 8:52am


Cases 16CM75, 16CM77 called together at 8:52am [mo]

As to Cases 16CM75, and 16CM77(Initial Appearance occurs):
If Atty Wineke has not been appointed on all of Mr. Shaurette's cases; the Court orders that she is now appointed.

Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered
Atty. Wineke requests a speedy trial

As to each Defendant:
The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with the Co- Defendant
--no use of airsoft or BB gun
--no possession of any dangerous weapons as defined by statute
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court distributes its scheduling order
recess in cases 16CM75 and 16CM77 at 9:06am (Attorney Wineke and Mr. Shaurette exit the courtroom)

The Court calls case 16CM73 at 9:07am
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived

As to Case 16CM73:
The Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without valid prescription
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no contact with Drew Taylor, Teeghun Taylor or the juvenile with the initials A.W (dob 11/24/1999)
--not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess: 9:10am

NEXT:   As to Cases 15CF407 and 15CF409: (1)Motion Hearing on 4/1/16 at 2:45pm (2)FSSC on 5/16/16 at 10:15am (3)Jury Trial on 6/2/16 and 6/3/16 at 8:30am
              As to Cases 16CM75 and 16CM77: (1)Motion Hearing on 4/1/16 at 2:45pm  (2)FSSC 4/4/16 at 8:10am  on (3)Jury Trial on 5/5 and 5/6/16 at 8:30am 
             As to Case 16CM73: (1)Pretrial Conference on 3/23/16 at 11:20am (2)Status Conference on 4/1/16 at 2:45pm
